content.question: A figure skater is spinning with her arms outstretched such that her rotational inertia is <math alttext="I" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>I</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>. She is spinning with an angular speed <math alttext="omega sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>ω</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>. She pulls in her arms such that her rotational inertia reduces to <math alttext="one third I" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mi>I</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>. Her new angular speed will be

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
